intro: Dipelta, commonly known as the pinkroot, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbel-shaped flower clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its roots are sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine. The flowers bloom in early spring, adding a delicate pink hue to the landscape.
